Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Prescribing the Threshold Amount Respecting Specified Tangible Personal Property

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to subsection 277(1)* of the Excise Tax Act, is pleased hereby to make the annexed Regulations prescribing the threshold amount and percentage of the tax respecting specified tangible personal property.

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Specified Tangible Personal Property (GST/HST) Regulations.
For the purposes of sections 183 and 184 of the Excise Tax Act, the prescribed amount in respect of specified tangible personal property is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the property is a print, an etching, a drawing, a painting, a sculpture or other similar work of art, $2,000;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where the property is a rare folio, a rare manuscript or a rare book, $2,000;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: where the property is a stamp, the face value of the stamp; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where the property is a coin, zero.

Subsection.Text: Section 2 is deemed to have come into force on April 1, 1997.
